intro: I am a journalist who specializes in telling visual stories with code. By blending design, interactive graphics, and data, I transform complex datasets into clearer, more accessible information, helping readers make sense of the news.
Currently I am based in Seoul, South Korea, and work on the News Design team at The Washington Post, building rich, highly customized interactive storytelling experiences and web applications.
Recently, I was part of the team at the Post that won the 2024 Pulitzer Prize in National Reporting for our ‘American Icon’ series, which chronicled the rise of the AR-15 rifle in the U.S.
Feel free to get in touch — I’d love to hear from you. And thank you for stopping by.

work.name: The Washington Post
work.title: News Designer, Design and Graphics Intern
work.desc: Collaborate with designers and graphics reporters to design and develop web presentations of enterprise projects. Build bespoke storytelling tools and components for the Post's website. Create interactive graphics for data-driven political stories.

work.name: Howard Center for Investigative Journalism
work.title: Fellow, Data Reporter
work.desc: Ran advanced data analyses in R and Python to develop promising leads and story ideas. Filed public records requests to gather data. Designed and built interactive graphics to supplement storytelling.

work.name: Capital News Service
work.title: Data and Graphics Reporter
work.desc: Designed graphics and programmed interactive maps and visualizations. Wrote Python web scrapers to automate data collection. Created news apps and long-form web presentations to present data-driven stories visually.

work.name: NBC News
work.title: Data Graphics Intern
work.desc: Pitched, reported and wrote data-driven stories. Analyzed data sets to develop story ideas. Built engaging charts, maps and graphics for stories to explain the news visually.

awards.category: Katharine Graham Award for Courage and Accountability
Bronze medal for individual design and development portfolio
